result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindi L Carrion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cindi L Carrion in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Cindi L Carrion in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:36 AM Court calls case.

Court takes a moment to review the file.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, Defendant was originally sentenced on June 10, 2015.  
Atty Constable states factual basis for the revocation, for the record. There is 70 days of sentence credit.

State makes recommendation of Defendant belonging into adult drug court in Wood County.  State is in the process of consolidating new charges to Wood County.

State recommends 90 days jail with credit for 70 days, with good time, that would work out to time served, any unpaid fines/restitutions be reduced to civil judgment. There is $140 restitution and does not believe it has been paid.  

Atty Drengler concurs with recommendation, is in the process of having everything consolidated to Wood County.  

BY THE COURT:
Impose 90 day jail sentence.
70 Days Credit.
With good time, this is a time served sentence.
Restitution of $140 is to be reduced to civil judgment in favor of the victim, A.B.
Defendant to comply with terms of bond in other cases.
Unpaid fines are to be entered into a civil judgment.  

Defendant will remain in custody here, on another matter, until further action.

State has complied with victim notification statues.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-04-2015 08:30 am
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

2:10 p.m. Defendant Cindi L Carrion in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation w/conditions stated on the record.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Victim compliance was done.
ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:**********PROBATION********
W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation
Conditions:
Pay restitution of $140.00 to be paid in 60 days.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge to be paid in 60 days.
No contact with Anita Bedward.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Cindi L Carrion
Current: 3500 Bush Street Apt 9, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2015)
Prior: 3151 Plover Road #5, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
$500.00 signature bond, with the conditions the Defendant have no contact with the victim, Anita Bedward.

Defendant Cindi L Carrion in court, in custody, appears by video.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:13 a.m.  Court calls case, and states appearances.  Court questions the Defendant regarding her non-appearance for her last Court appearance.  Defendant states she was in custody, and did let them know she had court, but they did not release her.  Defendant is in jail on a Probation Revocation.

Defendant has received the Criminal complain, and understands the charges.  Court will enter a plea of Not Guilty, and schedule this for a Pretrial in Br. II, for March 2, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  

Atty Constable makes a bond request of a $500.00 signature bond, with the conditions that the Defendant have no contact with the victim, Anita Bedward.

BTC:  Court will order a $500.00 signature bond, with the conditions the Defendant have no contact with the victim, Anita Bedward.  Warrant to be quashed.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not present. Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:12 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Atty McFarland indicates his client's address is the Waupaca County Jail.  He thought she would be appearing in custody today. 
Court reviews the file. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal Warrant.  $250 cash alternative.
